result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Torrence V Sheppard

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10-14-22

Defendant Torrence V Sheppard not in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Torrence V Sheppard.  Defendant's appearance waived. Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr for Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requested plea and sentencing date. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Amended Supervision Report- 09-19-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-15-22

Defendant Torrence V Sheppard appeared by video.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Torrence V Sheppard.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense received discovery and offer requested adjournment to find out if case can be transferred to drug treatment court.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Defendant/Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($500.00 signature bond) LW
Justice Point Supervision LEVEL 3. All other previously ordered conditions remain.

Defendant Torrence V Sheppard in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Torrence V Sheppard in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Torrence V Sheppard appeared by video means.   Case calendared for return on warrant. Bail/bond hearing proceeded. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court sets a signature bail at $1,000. Court increases Justice Point supervision to LEVEL 3. All other conditions remain as previously set.   

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 08/01/2022. Original bench warrant scanned. Case is adjourned for Return of Bench Warrant on 08/08/2022 at 10:30 am before Branch 16. Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

03:50 PM Attorney Connor Romenesko in court by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Attorney Haley Wentz in court on behalf of Connor Romenesko.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Torrence V Sheppard in court with Student Intern Simon Earle under the supervision of attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Torrence V Sheppard in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Torrence V Sheppard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
